entry.title: Apple Watch Ultra: First Impressions From an Everyday Carry Enthusiast!

media:group.media:title: Apple Watch Ultra: First Impressions From an Everyday Carry Enthusiast!
media:group.media:description:
I'm a bit obsessed with what I carry in my pockets. This video looks at how the Apple Watch Ultra fits into my Everyday Carry (EDC) pocket carry system.
I'm especially interested in the impact the Apple Watch Ultra has on letting me no longer carry my phone when I'm away from home. This is the real advantage of the new battery life the way I'm seeing it because it means it can last a day even when using only cellular signal.
Watch this video next: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IuFOx9HJbTw
Amazon UK are doing 5 monthly payments at 0% (the best way to buy things with warrantees): Amazon UK: https://amzn.to/3DgXhMx Amazon US: https://amzn.to/3TJTmxj
Using these links supports the channel - much appreciated.
#edc #applewatch #applewatchultra
-------------------------------------------------------------------------- Contents: --------------------------------------------------------------------------
0:00 What is EDC? 0:48 The first watch that really excited me 1:12 Why the Apple Watch Ultra is so interesting 1:54 Apple Watch Ultra Design is beautiful 2:43 What people are missing about the longer battery life 3:42 Two disappointments 4:57 Can the Ultra replace my pocket torch/flashlight? 6:26 All the things I no longer need to carry 6:47 Focus states make the Ultra really useful 7:22 Screen size and responsiveness 8:33 Is the Ultra going off-piste for Apple?

entry.title: Dear Apple, Can We Get a Treadmill Desk Workout Mode?

media:group.media:title: Dear Apple, Can We Get a Treadmill Desk Workout Mode?
media:group.media:description:
We really need a treadmill desk workout mode for Apple Watch!
I'm enjoying using the treadmill desk but would really like to know how many steps and what distance I'm doing. Unfortunately the Apple Watch doesn't have a mode to track the activity while I'm using the treadmill desk.
Learn more about my custom keyboard here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UKfeJrRIcxw&list=PLCZYyvXAdQpte8dkCPz72m_O-Od9fVEqD
See my thoughts on Apple Watch Ultra here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KUbigJVMD_s

entry.title: Is Apple Watch Ultra Too Big to Daily?

media:group.media:title: Is Apple Watch Ultra Too Big to Daily?
media:group.media:description:
I'm almost sold on the idea of the Apple Watch Ultra but I am slightly on the fence about its size. Will it just feel too big to wear day to day?
In this video I compare the Apple Watch Ultra with my Apple Watch Series 5 to see just how much bigger it feels and looks.
Many thanks to the Apple Store in Bath for being very accommodating with their filming policy. (I was allowed to film the device but not customers, staff or audio, which I felt was more than reasonable so I'm very grateful for that).

entry.title: People still don't realise this about Teslas

media:group.media:title: People still don't realise this about Teslas
media:group.media:description:
People still don't realise this about Tesla cost of ownership and how it impacts your lifestyle. The implication of switching a per-mile expense (petrol) to an up front one (or at least front-loaded with finance etc) are significant as you don't worry about the cost of individual journeys any more.

entry.title: Apple Watch Ultra vs. EDC Philosophy

media:group.media:title: Apple Watch Ultra vs. EDC Philosophy
media:group.media:description:
As both a fan of EDC philosophy and the original Apple Watch I thought I would offer some discussion on the rather divided opinion on Apple Watch among EDC enthusiasts.
I look at the unique set of features that I find so appealing about the original Apple Watch and then explore the new features and value proposition of the Apple Watch Ultra.
I also explore some more philosophical points that seem to overlap here in terms of software freedom and Apple's approach.
By the way EDC stands for Everyday Carry - it is a community/philosophy/idea that encompasses the generally obsessive hobby of refining the gear we carry on our person every day. It is taken very seriously by those who enjoy the process of selecting the right things. Things like knives, watches, wallets, torches/flashlights etc are all common things that go into people‚Äôs EDC kits. Learn more here: https://everydaycarry.com/what-is-edc-everyday-carry-guide
-------------------------------------------------------------------------- Contents: --------------------------------------------------------------------------
0:00 Introduction 0:22 Is Apple software too restrictive? 1:29 Apple Watch features I use 5:06 Where the normal Apple Watch falls down for EDC 6:40 Is the Apple Watch Ultra too expensive? 7:50 Apple Watch Ultra new features 13:31 Is Apple Watch finally good enough for EDC enthusiasts?
#edc #apple #applewatch -------------------------------------------------------------------------- üé¨ My YouTube camera gear: --------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: Apple Watch Ultra Is a DISRUPTER - Here's Why

media:group.media:title: Apple Watch Ultra Is a DISRUPTER - Here's Why
media:group.media:description:
Some of my initial thoughts on the new Apple Watch Ultra. At first I thought this was just a nice upsell to top off the Apple Watch range for those who wanted, and could afford, the best.
However, I'm now thinking that it actually is a lot more than that. I think it actually disrupts the entire industry. It will hurt fitness watches, action/tough watches, dive watches as well as convincing people to spend more on an Apple Watch if they were already looking at one.
In this video I go through some of my thoughts on the Apple Watch Ultra that I think has the potential to be massive.

entry.title: These Rare PCB Colors Are PERFECT for DIY Keyboards

media:group.media:title: These Rare PCB Colors Are PERFECT for DIY Keyboards
media:group.media:description:
Let's look at these awesome rare colours available with PCBWay's Advanced PCB service. These boards looks fantastic and make a great choice for DIY custom keyboards.
Thanks to my sponsor PCBWay for supporting this video. PCBWay offer PCB fabrication, CNC and 3D Printing and more. They have been super efficient and friendly with all the projects I‚Äôve used them for and I‚Äôm very happy to recommend them. You can use this link to support the channel. https://www.pcbway.com/setinvite.aspx?inviteid=499614
You can order this board from PCBWay with this direct link: https://www.pcbway.com/project/shareproject/18_Key_Keyboard_The_Piano_2_afbac38f.html
-------------------------------------------------------------------------- Parts list: --------------------------------------------------------------------------
Kailh Choc switches (I used the light blue liner ones from https://splitkb.com/products/kailh-low-profile-choc-switches MBK Blank Keycaps https://splitkb.com/products/blank-mbk-choc-low-profile-keycaps Hotswap Sockets (Choc) https://splitkb.com/products/kailh-hotswap-sockets Socket pins (pins only) https://splitkb.com/products/mill-max-low-profile-sockets Diodes to chop up as DIY socket pins: Amazon UK: https://amzn.to/3alKTPo Amazon US: https://amzn.to/3wLcHEg Full height machine pin sockets https://mechboards.co.uk/products/machine-pin-sockets Reset button https://www.aliexpress.com/item/33013562004.html (Uses the b3u1000p footprint in my Ergogen fork) Better version of reset button (matches the footprint better but more expensive) https://www.aliexpress.com/item/1005002267741606.html?spm=a2g0o.order_list.0.0.4eef1802z5TqoV Battery connector (2p curved) https://www.aliexpress.com/item/1005002096347570.html (Uses the bat footprint in my Ergogen fork) Power switch https://www.aliexpress.com/item/4000685483225.html (Uses the pcm12 footprint in my Ergogen fork) Nice!nano v2 https://splitkb.com/products/nice-nano or https://mechboards.co.uk/products/nice-nano-v2 Batteries: https://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/194001009975
-------------------------------------------------------------------------- ü™õSoldering Essentials! -------------------------------------------------------------------------- Tooling up with these links helps me out at no extra cost to you. Thanks! üôè
Heat Proof Mat: Amazon UK: https://amzn.to/3nn8tiB Amazon US: https://amzn.to/3nn8tiB

Flux Pen: Amazon UK: https://amzn.to/3IemWVP Amazon US: https://amzn.to/3Ko9lNm
Snips: Amazon UK: https://amzn.to/3PCkX22 Amazon US: https://amzn.to/3GedYYR
Downloads: My fork of Ergogen: https://github.com/benvallack/ergogen (See this video for details: https://youtu.be/M_VuXVErD6E ) KiCad: https://www.kicad.org Ergogen UI: https://ergogen.cache.works Layout firmware: https://github.com/benvallack/zmk-config-piano
Watch this next for more details on my custom keyboard framework: https://youtu.be/UKfeJrRIcxw

entry.title: Designing a BACKUP ROUTINE You'll Actually Use

media:group.media:title: Designing a BACKUP ROUTINE You'll Actually Use
media:group.media:description:
A truly effective backup routine needs to protect against on-site disaster, ransomeware, human error and hardware failure. But one size doesn't fit all - you need different systems for different risks. In this video I go into all the variables and design a hassle-free, affordable system that you'll actually use.
Thanks to my sponsor PCBWay for supporting this video. PCBWay offer PCB fabrication, CNC and 3D Printing and more. They have been super efficient and friendly with all the projects I‚Äôve used them for and I‚Äôm very happy to recommend them. You can use this link to support the channel. https://www.pcbway.com/setinvite.aspx?inviteid=499614
You can order my PCB directly using this link: https://www.pcbway.com/project/shareproject/Single_key_keyboard_43be72a3.html
Backup Essentials: (using these links to buy gear helps support the channel)
Cheap 16TB hard drive: Amazon UK: https://amzn.to/3pVb97F Amazon US: https://amzn.to/3pVIHT1
Hard drive dock: Amazon UK: https://amzn.to/3Q4a48i Amazon US: https://amzn.to/3R42ITw
Peli case: Amazon UK: https://amzn.to/3cw1TUo Amazon US: https://amzn.to/3wIZvRc
Software: Carbon Copy Cloner: https://bombich.com
Contents:
0:00 Intro 1:14 Risk Profile Aspects 1:59 Risk Profiles 3:13 File Storage Concept 3:41 Protecting System Drive 4:41 Offsite Protection 5:13 Speed of Recovery 5:35 Protect from Human Error 6:36 Ransomeware 7:26 Summary of System Drive Protection 8:11 Archive Drive Protection 9:33 Hardware Choices 10:19 Protect from Power Failure 11:17 Don't Wait - Get Protected!

media:group.media:description:
In this video I look in some detail at these great home automation smart blinds from SmartWings. I look at aesthetics, installation, sound, integration, ordering, manual control and what you can expect from smart blinds/shades in general.
They work with Siri/HomeKit, Alexa and Google smart assistants and they really are lovely smart shades that will upgrade any home.
Learn more: https://www.smartwingshome.com

entry.title: My Tesla Crushed My Finger - Seriously

media:group.media:title: My Tesla Crushed My Finger - Seriously
media:group.media:description:
I found myself in an unusual situation where I wanted to manually close the boot, slowly to check the glass would clear the treadmill (for use as a desk!) I‚Äôd just loaded up. The trouble is, if you‚Äôve got your fingers over the edge when it‚Äôs just about to close something pretty terrifying happens!
